tkV7rEqC5R2qe_NqTNelhA.text: I went here yesterday with a friend. The customer service was really good. We ordered the red curry. Out to 5 for spice we got a 3. At a 3 it was still really spicy. Still good. The portion was very small in my opinion. We also ordered the sesame chicken. It was very good. A little bit too much batter but still good.

hAQcjWYQAjU6ZCoT3EiRTw.text: Great place to grab a business lunch. Service is always fast and courteous, and the food is good.

ZgxUpiO04E0t0CT_dYmWMw.text: Food is a pretty good. I eat their pad Thai lunch specials all the time and it's by far the best I've had in Charlotte. I usually order the pad see ew, it was okay here. Would definitely recommend it to a friend for lunch.

DySpQWNUeRwno8YWijM_ig.text: Met an old friend here for lunch yesterday, Saturday 4/25.  We started a Thai iced coffee (for her) and a Thai iced tea (for me).  I had informed our server of my food allergies, of which he took time to notate down before heading of to the kitchen.  He did say that Thai Taste is more than willing to accomodate by omitting the ingredients I couldn't eat and substituting items that are more appropriate.  I asked if TT made their own curry pastes, and he said yes (and no, they do not use shrimp or shrimp paste in their curry pastes!).  I had spotted the daily specials board located outside by the front entrance that included soft-shelled crab (2 pcs.) with chu chee sauce and jasmine rice for $16.95.  (Mango sticky rice and Thai fried ice cream (!) were also featured.)  Our server said that if we did not like chu chee sauce (a coconut-based red curry sauce traditionally used with seafood, such as scallops and prawns/shrimp), we could opt for basil or ginger sauce.  I was also eyeing Pud Thai (their spelling) or green curry with tofu.  When I told Tina about the crab special, she ooh'ed and ah'ed, so we decided we'd split an entree.  Our server, however, had bad news- he was just told he'd have to go to the grocery for a crab run as the kitchen had just run out! Tina decided she would get the Larb with chicken (basically a spicy dish of ground chicken lettuce wraps), and I ordered the green curry.  Tina started her meal with celery soup, a soup I'd encountered at almost every Thai venue I've eaten at, but this version contained grains that looked like barley.  She thought it was good.    We didn't have to wait long for our entrees.  Her larb with chicken came out first, and what a beautiful sight it was!  It smelled marvelous, too, and Tina dished out a generous serving for me to try.  My green curry, with carrots, peas, green beans, bamboo shoots, broccoli, and tofu, was not far behind; The bowl in which it was served in was smaller than I've seen elsewhere, and without the usual accompaniments of soup and eggroll (due to my food allergies), $7.95 for a basically a cup of green curry and jasmine rice was pricey.  I think the kitchen added broccoli to sub for the eggroll, as it was not listed as an ingredient in green curry.  (For anyone with a mustard allergy- broccoli is listed as one of over 300 plants within the mustard family.)  I have to say that this green curry dish ranks as one of the best I've ever tried (mirroring Phoenix's Thai Elephant's on Adams and Thai Hut's, Mesa's Palee's Crown's, and Scottsdale's Tottie's Asian Fusion's)!  I could drink the green curry elixir straight  from the bowl!  It was that good!  Clean, comfortable setting, great food, awesome service, and bright and clean women's restroom- what more can one ask for?  Ah, maybe an ample supply of soft-shelled crabs?  Haha!  No worries there, as the menu seems very promising!  Great QC spot for Thai!  I'll be visiting again before flying home.  (Actually, I wasn't able to go back a second time, but my sister took her coworker to lunch soon after, and they both LOVED the green curry!)

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Green curry with tofu, $7.95, comes with soup, eggroll, and jasmine rice.
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai iced tea, $1.75 (?).

_6Q6dFNpFYL19orx1GORdg.text: Lunch menu isn't great. Dinner is decent. Would avoid coming for lunch. Dinner it is ok to be here. And if you go a little late for dinner, the person asks if its take out :P ? Haha! New way to say to customers, go away! Avoid lunch for sure.. Not worth at all.

s-ddgqzPX_8BMY4tQ-AZ0w.text: Worst food ever. I love Thai food but did not like this place. Will never go back.  The ambience was a little ok and the staff were friendly but they could try to improve the taste of the food to get people come in.

kJHSGGdnySrY3avczcccmg.text: Pad Thai is usually a good indicator of how the food is in a Thai restaurant. Theirs is quite good. Not too heavy. Not too much sauce. Just right.

iys6YOxoLQtdU1Ij_o6a9g.text: After visiting a few Thai restaurants in larger cities, I am pleased at how many things this place gets right.   Food is great.

_v3ZGRDGeUrADoMBEHwz8g.text: Went during lunch and ordered vegetarian pad Thai with tofu. Food was fast, yet hot. Very moist and tasty. Wish I would have asked about spice level because I would have liked mine kicked up a few notches yet not a huge deal. With lunch you get small bowel of soup, spring roll, and iced tea with entree. Would definitely go back!

46kYpygjtbAVEIQ6mOXmKQ.text: The food is great but the service And manager are horrible. She does not know good customer service or mannerism while she is talking. Byebye good food all because of your ill mannered management.

HbVI0CZEGhTL94wOIuBA8Q.text: Stopped here on a Saturday night because hickory tavern was on a wait. The food was good. I had a soup (that I can't pronounce) it was tasty with lots of veggies. I also had the Thai salad but that was not very good. It was drenched in dressing and the dressing was off putting. My companion had the chicken pad Thai and it was very tasty. The service was just ok. I would go back and get the pad Thai to go.

OItskk6ZoMOmuuCOHUy13Q.text: I eat here all the time!  I love it!  The food is delicious and the one time my order wasn't right, they gave me a free meal.  One of the best Thai places I have ever been to.  The waitstaff is so friendly and fast.

wmMwk_cQaLXvh3shu_YZqg.text: It is obvious they do not have and they never did in their existence have a professional Thai cook managing the kitchen. Every Time i have been there, the food taste is similar to how a novice would make thai food at home with thai spices and paste from the grocery store. Too bad, since Thai is my one of my favorite cuisine and this place is very close. Over the years, i have tried giving them another chance, but i am better off driving some distance when i am in mood for thai.

_dGmvnGhL3EexFL_JMxS2w.text: Solid Thai food at a fair price.  Thai House in Univeristy area has better music, decor, and ambience, but costs about 30% more.

dEqV5juWY4pyXbvBkondRg.text: Have been here multiple times. It was much better a few months ago. Went here the other day and service was really slow even though it was not busy, we got our drinks/food at the same time. There were many vegetables in the dish either. The lunch dishes are much smaller.

tCoWWT_iSp8z8QwBMxNkNQ.text: Perfectly authentic Thai cuisine. Always tasty, never a misfire. Specials are always rewarding, and standards like pad Thai are expertly executed. This is a very simple little place in a strip mall, but so delicious and welcoming. Highly recommended!

HSb5D6PFnxNe1ySd8Cdpzg.text: I love thai food, and was happy to find a place close to home that had such good flavors. My all time favorites are pad thai and Panang and they are really good here.Service is fast and friendly. Last time I went there, I ordered a thai coffee, now I can say I'm addicted. From the appetizers, I like the fresh rolls, Ka Nom Jeb (dumplings). I've tried the Sar Tah (chicken kabobs w/ peanut sauce) but I'm not crazy about the flavor of the peanut sauce. It seems like they have really good lunch specials, but as it is the prices are very affordable. I will definitely go again when craving thai food.

4dwYz0PNZHuAhbOjmrV_jw.text: I managed to venture back recently and was still not impressed.  And, my rice was STILL dry...so, I don't see the point torturing my palate any further.  Hopefully, ya'll have better luck than I did.    Do stop in for Thai Tea...that's about the best thing on the menu :(

vmVDA8r7plynih7mcbfFvg.text: This place is right outside my subdivision and is in walking distance from my home.    Great food, the best values are at lunch, but dinner won't blow the budget either. My first dish there was Pad Thai and I wasn't disappointed.  Later on I discovered their Thai Curry dishes (the one with red curry in coconut cream sauce with bamboo shoots- I can never remember the name)  The folks there are very nice and helpful and the see a lot of me on "pick it up" days.  The inside has a nice feel to it.  I just wish they made sweet tea...

sL5lHWlo4wwGicW90WTEYA.text: Thai Taste is one of the best Thai Restaurants I have ever been to.  The food is very authentic, flavorful, and fresh.  The staff is extremely nice and provided great service.  The food comes out quick and hot.   You can specify how spicy you want your dish.  I have had level 3 each time I have gone and it has been perfect.  I like my food spicy.  Each time I come to Charlotte, I make time for this amazing restaurant.

MGpCBs3tz7oOwBm3LLAiNQ.text: A friend and I decided to go there tonight and I like Thai food, though I'm not going to claim to be an expert. Though the front was empty and it left me a little uneasy it seemed that diners were being seating in the back where they have some beautiful embroidery displayed. Our waitress was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu as my friend is gluten sensitive which is always nice, and she did advise that they tend to be a little spicy but offered to bring more of the spice to the table in case we wanted a higher level of heat.  The food came out fairly quickly (but not scary quick) and was delicious. We had hot tea, chicken sar teh (with an awesome peanut sauce), I had Gaeng Panang (red curry with pineapple and basil) with chicken, though it was missing the basil the pineapple didn't taste canned which I've had happen.  My friend had Mussamun Curry with chicken and poh tak (seafood soup) with banana sticky rice for desert (though my friend thought it was a little stiff). The waitress' seemed attentive, refilled our pot of tea without asking, clearing plates, and helpful.

VqLjtmf2Ab39yeL7jrLLsg.text: Bought a Groupon and went to use it before the expiration date. They closed for a whole week on vacation ---nothing mentioned on their phone voicemail about closing for vacation. After wasting time and gasoline going the first time we went today---They would not accept Groupon because it was expired now. Go at your own risk--- but they may shut down for a lunch break of their own and not be there. Very Poor customer service -will never go back!!

9k6Q9lofDxwR3dcBHoxGig.text: Tonight was my first time visiting Thai Taste, and I wasn't disappointed.  Arriving around 6:00 PM we were promptly seated.  The menu is simple, but has a lot of options.  We were there during happy hour and were offered a selection of either spring rolls (fresh or lightly fried) free with our dinner purchase.  We opted for the lightly fried spring rolls which were delivered quickly.  They were simple but a good start to the meal.  I tried a Tom Yum soup at a medium spice with chicken for the next taste.  The soup was great, nice kick in spice but not over powering.  Broth was delicious and reminded me of a Thai restaurant I frequented in New York.  For the main course we opted for a cashew chicken stir fry and a garlic based chicken stir fry.  Both were great with an over generous portion.  So much food and so little room that we brought half home.  The waitress helped package the leftovers and even included more fresh rice in the box, an unexpected treat.  With a selection of alcoholic beverages and tip on top of the overall meal; the bill was under $50 for two.  Looking forward to going back!

cH1JIAzFRN3bPh1OSbSeIA.text: Best Thai in Charlotte (after basil). Chicken pad Thai with No 2 spice is great. Also the dish with curry is good. They serve complimentary soup and the service is always timely.

rK4JRd2kMuiDRTxXGYOCDw.text: I've eaten here a few times and always leave extremely satisfied. The red curry is everything you'd want in a curry. My wife and I were in a hurry and let them know when we got there. We got in and out in 20 minutes. The customer service is top notch!

uuxayu4WBlDYAAc85AeoMQ.text: I'm not an easy five. Thai Taste earns this rating from me because of authenticity, terrific service, consistency, and variety. I guess I should throw in amazingly delicious as well. They've got a terrific lunch menu that keeps my colleagues and I coming back for more. At this point, the staff know us. We don't even look at the menu. Instead, we simply ask for a recommendation and are never disappointed.

KVcJWtYWoOTAfpD9ADJiyA.text: Thai taste is by far one of my favorite places for take out or lunch!! I frequent the south blvd location more but either location is just as good and the staff is ALWAYS happy and smiling and Sooo nice! Food is the best! I recommend pad Thai or red curry with shrimp!!

Uq3dbIYeWCuArM-R0ytpyQ.text: My boyfriend wanted chinese takeout tonight. I suggested we try a thai place instead, because these days I'm incredibly tired of greasy american style chinese. He hates spicy food so I played it safe and ordered for the both of us-an order of their Thai Fried Rice, an order Pad See Ewe, and an order of their steamed dumplings. I'm incredibly pleased with our dinner tonight. Takeout only took 10 minutes. (just enough time to put on pants, get in the car, and go pick it up) I don't see myself dining in at any point because I truly am a takeout person when it comes to weeknights and asian food, but their restaurant was clean and very cute. Service was very fast and courteous. The food tasted fresh off the wok and was well seasoned for two non-spicy dishes. (Again, I love spicy but I'm trying to convert the significant other from chinese to thai so baby steps) A lot of pad see ewe's I've tried in the past had unreasonably thick, chewy noodles, which was refreshingly not the case here. Will definitely be ordering again.

kpuvjlT62AZ1txqWXO4HGg.text: My wife and I and our two daughters ate here and did not have a good experience. Two of the four dishes contained bamboo shoots that had not been prepared properly and gave the dishes  a disgusting, strong ammonia smell that made them inedible. We asked them to replace one of the dishes with a different item,(which was good), and salvaged the other  by removing all the bamboo shoots. This is such a basic error that I would never recommend this place to anyone.

A1_SlT3Dhd89B3S7QZrgmA.text: 's place is so good. A hidden gem. So happy we tried it today. My kids really loved it too. We can't wait to come back again and try something new. The lunch specials are great!!

i_Er7gBR-aco3Wvz5i6C1A.text: I was first introduced to Thai Taste on East Blvd and I've been coming here ever since.  I've had so many different dishes here and they've all been superb....I can't even pick a favorite...Gaeng Jerd, Koong Ob Mor Din, Poh Heang, Pad Woon Sen, and the fried rice are all amazingly good

780PBIWGzjN5GmTw8Y9vgg.text: Great food, and not heavy.  They get the orders right and service is good.  One of my favorite places to eat in the university area.

tWNxSJRQiJpn_3ltH5IKKw.text: I took my Mother here for her birthday on April 11th. Worst Thai restaurant I have ever been to! We ordered veggie spring rolls and they only had cabbage in them....just cabbage....nothing else.  The food was not fresh and the employees were not friendly. The decor was very dated and the tables looked like they were from the dollar tree. We will never be back. If I could give this place 0 stars I would.

oupWi_ceSonGDAC0PeKF1g.text: First, I'm sorry to say it, because even though it was take out, the customer service was fantastic, and the guy on the phone was, dare I say, warm and charming even, and very helpful answering my questions.  But. Charlotte, we've got some problems. First off, the tom kha soup was the saltiest I have ever had. It's my favorite Thai soup so I've had plenty, and typically it is mildly sweet and fragrant. This soup was as salty as Campbell's chicken noodle soup! (Which, if you're not familiar, is salty like a pretzel factory exploded nearby.) I actually couldn't eat it. I tried. Also the mushrooms looked old, and I couldn't taste any lemongrass. :-/  F  The side salad was definitely promising. It had lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, cucumber, sprouts and two pieces of fried tofu, which was a nice surprise! Unfortunately, it was only an okay salad. To their credit, it was larger and more ambitious than most restaurant side salads, but the dressing, while tasty, was fairly lumpy. I'm willing to overlook it. B  Finally, I ordered the chicken fried rice with vegetables. I cannot actually weigh the taste honestly because my palate was completely wrecked by the soup, which I kept trying to make work even though I knew better, because it really is my favorite, and I was in sodium denial. That was totally my mistake, not the fried rice's. So, I'll say it tasted okay. Not great but fine. However... the broccoli was in giant florets I had to cut down to manageable size, and they were old. (You can tell because they had dark/black stuff on them which is what happens when the broccoli was sliced a few days ago.) I threw out the stumps with black stuff and salvaged the rest, but that's just not what you want to do with your take out. If I'd made it myself, and it was my first try at making Thai food from a Pinterest recipe, sure. I'd throw in a potato to leech out the extra salt, and cut off the black parts, and be right proud of myself. But, from a restaurant, I want better. C? B-?   Again, the service was great. They just need to hire new cooks. (And get rid of that weird section of the wall for selling jewelry. It really brings down the ambiance.) If they do, I'd be happy to try them again. Until then, I'm afraid not.

7oTM7tcrkDeT_8WOSniG6g.text: I've been to a few Thai restaurants in Charlotte looking for that amazing Thai flavor I got at the Thai joints back home (Miami) and sadly I am still looking.  However, for the time being this one is close.  I have not been here enough times to be able to rate consistency but on my last visit I was pleased.  I ordered their cashew and vegetable dish and it was so good I almost licked the remaining sauce off the plate.   Im still dreaming about that wonderful basil infused spicy, salty, brothy, tasty sauce.   The vegetarian spring rolls were also delish and they include 4. I almost  jumped out of my chair when they asked if I wanted dessert and then mentioned 3 on the menu.  What!?!?!  Dessert?  No Thai place I've been to here has dessert other than sticky rice with mango, if any at all.  YAY!!!!  I ordered the fried ice cream and it was a nice ending to a great meal.  No, it still doesn't compare to the lucious fried ice cream they serve in Miami floating on top of a sweetened condensed coconut milk and drizzled with chocolate sauce..... **drool**  but it will do.   If they add fried Thai donuts to the menu they will have a loyal Fan.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried ice cream

_adrUiGqIKGR7Iq3mJR0dg.text: Our favorite Thai restaurant in town. Authentic, fresh and good ... What else could you want?

pciRaoVBjplD5dVCue7aOQ.text: Great food... and great lunch specials.  Service is fast and friendly.... you can get in and out pretty quickly or even east at your leisure (since the place is nicely decorated with images - I'm assuming from Thailand or the Thai artwork on the walls).  You can customize your heat level if needed, but I usually leave it up to the chef and it's right about a medium.  There are two entrances to this location so it can get a little disorienting, but the place is cozy enough to "right the ship" before it sails out the wrong door.  Even if it does, it's not that bad of a walk around the building.  It also looks like they sell jewelry in the lobby area, not sure if the owner makes it his/herself, but it's a great idea to kill time if you are waiting on a table.

APUFw5Mu-31I9HZ9ND__Vw.text: Food is ok. My pad Thai was way too sweet! The restaurant can use some light! Too dim!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai with Tom yum soup

qqv2MP2Ltgs8DwlOMI-u6w.text: I haven't been to the other Thai restaurants in the area, but that's because I've really enjoyed their food.  I've always been promptly seated and the food is served quickly.  I  usually get a dish that has seafood and they have yet to disappoint me.  The scallops and squid are never over-cooked.  Plus, I really like that the food can be spicy.  Level 4 spiciness will leave your lips tingling and that feels good.

MrbvMe3SRKIlDUN3aM5o7g.text: Went there for lunch yesterday, the lunch menu is kind of expensive. They give you an egg roll, but each item is almost 9 bucks, and the quantity is not that generous. I would stick with dinner.

NUIjnIiO0nkxtUNT4UXQ8g.text: Love! Love! Love! As a vegetarian, this is one of my favorite places to go for lunch. I often get the pad thai. It is my favorite! I get it vegetarian, with no tofu. The service is excellent, and fast! The prices for the lunch special are excellent. You get soup, spring roll, and your main dish for less than $10! Oh, and that includes your tea if you choose to have that. Everyone in the restaurant is very nice, and very accommodating! I've been going here for 8 years. The only thing I would say is to be careful with your space number. Spice intensity ranges from 1 to 5. I used to get at 3, but have downgraded to a 2. I think the different chef are either heavy or less heavy handed on spice! Either way I'll be going here for as long as they're open!

Fs0Lwf9KEYQHt-C_hwkbTg.text: The Tod Mun Pla (fish balls) were the best thing I had.  The Pad Thai is supposed to be a signature dish of Thailand, this left much to be desired.  The food was said to be ready in 5 minutes and it was.  I don't know how anything remotely fresh is ready in 5 minutes.  There were no beansprouts to be found, if they were there then they felt and tasted like limp old noodles.  If I am in need of some slop to eat then you can go here.  If you want some real Thai food, I would suggest going somewhere else or at least not ordering any noodles.  Try a coconut based broth or curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tod Mun Pla (fish balls).  These were chewy but the flavor was great.  I have had them chewy before, I would prefer fresh.
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Where are the nice fresh sprouts?  I can&#39;t find them.  How about green onions that look green and on top for presentation?

MsdKNIIGJBLuDYdIc64yoA.text: My favorite Thai place! I love the asparagus and chicken dish! Great service and friendly staff!

lMk2xbYdImyWixcDke8riw.text: Great thai food in the university area. The service is generally exceptional. For a vegetarian who doesn't eat seafood, there are only a few options, as there is fish sauce or shrimp sauce in almost everything. True veg options: Tom Kha soup, veg fried rice & veg pad thai.   TOM KHA soup: the spiciness and the texture is a little inconsistent. In a large hot pot, some areas are thin and watery and some are thicker and a little grainy. If you keep stirring it, though, it's fine. Overall, I really like it. It's spicy (although spice level 4- the hottest offered- is not really that hot for someone who enjoys spicy food) and sour (lime?) and a little sweet and creamy from the coconut milk. I got this two nights in a row, so it's definitely good.   TOM YUM soup: this was actually spicy at level 4. Seemed healthy, with a broth base and lots of veggies. Very flavorful.   RED CURRY with vegetables: bamboo shoots, red peppers, peas in a sweetish but slightly spicy sauce. The sauce is a little grainy, but still tasty.   YUM NEUR salad with thinly sliced beef spiced with chilies, cilantro and lime juice - tasted sweet and spicy. The salad felt light and healthy but satisfying. Also, it was beautifully presented on a footed plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tom Kha bowl
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tom Yum hot pot
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef skewer appetizer

B2QPN0ZV5ftqmifcUxwxxQ.text: I love thai food and was excited to find out there was one in the area when I moved. But this location is horrible and the people that work there are even worse. I found a hair in my food and brought it to their attention only to get a condescending response. With that I asked to have my food remade which now o regret, (should have just asked for my money back and never returned). The lady disappeared to the back and came back full of attitude and with another man who yelled, next time just eat indian food. So first of all, their mediocre food had hair in it and then they spewed a racist comment at me. I will never return and have told everyone to stay away. Their restuarant is dead empty in the evenings, i understand why now. And they obviously have zero customer service skills. They totally ruined all Thai tastes for me, i loved the  south blvd location, but like the guy said i think i WILL take my money elsewhere because their hairy  oily food is definately not worth my time or money.

ss5L7erGE9PK9kV587DLqw.text: My review is based on the food and service, not the ambiance. If you're looking for a beautiful or cozy restaurant for date night, this would not be it. But if you're looking for the best Pad Thai in the area, then drive over here immediately! I like to go at lunch when the portions are not much smaller than dinner portions but a little cheaper. It comes with a spring roll and soup, both which are excellent. Be aware that if you order a soda it will be in a can so no free refills.   I've never had a bad meal here or bad service...they are tops in my book!

BFsMRUGYzEpISIw3TShfqg.text: This restaurant is very simple but very tasty. The customer service was very nice. Everyone was very nice and accommodating and helped answer questions I had. You are able to choose the spice level which was very helpful. I also ordered Thai Iced tea which was amazing! I would definitely eat here again!

aIDK8MOdOUyU-mR0608vkg.text: I love their lunch special. The lunch specials include a ice tea, soup, and a spring roll. I had the vegetarian Pad Thai and it was really good. If you work near the University and you want a quick lunch then you might want to try this place.

OmjNhEezMyJElp_aSuYrnw.text: Good place for lunch. Service is fast. Standard Thai fare.

K5P7Rn92LdtGfBCf_zdD0w.text: A coworker suggested this place to me a few months ago, so I decided to give it a try today since I was in the area. I got my order to go, but the dining room looked pretty nice. The customer service was top notch. The young man who took my order was also serving tables, but he didn't miss a beat.   I went to the bathroom, which was clean, and while I was walking out I noticed the array of photographs taken in Thailand which lined the walls. I appreciated going on this little art stroll while I waited for my food...but that wasn't very long lol...7-8 minutes at most.   I ordered the pad Thai (which is my go to when I'm trying a new Thai place for the first time). When I asked if there was like in the bag I was told the didn't have any like. The young man said they had lemon but that they don't usually include it with the meal because the food already has a lot of flavor...but that the would give me some. My thoughts were, I will be the judge of the food, get me some lemon just in case. I would be darned if he wasn't right! Lol. The food was fantastic, even without the added citrus. It stayed hot for a good while, and the dinner portion was plenty...enough to share with my bf, who I swear has a bottomless stomach sometimes.   I did get an extra egg in my pad Thai, which I was charged an extra dollar for (bringing my total to around $13)...my regular Thai spot never charges me for an extra egg, but my regular Thai spot isn't really this good either...and hey, I get it, the prices of chickens and their potential offspring who will never be is on the rise...can't afford to go around giving out free eggs and whatnot. Anyway, overall a solid spot that I will definitely go out of my way for next time.

KIB_aNZFwYwqKb8TOv_55A.text: I love this place! The food is always great and it comes out fast. The service is excellent and extremely attentive. I usually get the Pud Asparagus or the Kow Pud Sub Pra Ros (like a Thai fried rice). They are both really great! You get so much food for the price too. The soup is great and so are the spring rolls. They ask how spicy you want it and always make it exactly how I ask. They also have hot sauces you can add yourself to give it a little kick. Stop by this location or one of the other Charlotte area spots. You won't be disappointed!

BrJiHMevalLZZYH1LsGjaw.text: Me and my husband ordered Pad Thai and another dish. And we think they may used capsaicin for spicy taste (a kind of chemical irritant but not the natural one which from red peppers). Our stomachs already  been hurt and burned for three days(even we ate medicines). Terrible. Never back again.

VGka_d9K3Fw3eojjEhZ-ew.text: Their pad Thai and lahd na is very good. Their Thai tea also has a lot of flavor. Not too sweet, just enough cream to make it taste good.

VCYoUgPxneWX1m3gE5gnpA.text: After seeing all positive reviews, I wanted to try it out for lunch. I ordered the green curry. It was not served well. First of all , they serve the food in two minutes time. Seems it's already cooked and they just pre heat and serve. The next is it gives fouling smell, mostly it's carried from last day left over. After having few bites, I reported this to waiter and paid only for iced tea. They really agreed upon and said it will be good next time.

YtNowwuThgVnu2hgoKSOYQ.text: Took my female friend out for Thai food . Being her first time with this cuisine, I read great Yelp reviews of this place and decided to try it.  The restaurants decor is basic. If you are looking for a restaurant based on atmosphere, I suggest you look elsewhere. If you are looking for a place that has extremely flavorful Thai food, this place fits the bill! My friend and I tried 2 entrees and 1 appetizer. All 3 dishes were nice sized portions and quite tasty. We had a shrimp dish that had a nice amount of shrimp in it which is always a nice surprise. I'll be darned if I could remember the name of the dish, but idiot me didn't write down what it was lol. The wine menu is sparse but the sake they carry was quite good.  Our make server (Dan I believe) was extremely friendly and informative. He had worked there for years and just came back after a stint in Utah. His suggestions were spot on. As long as he remembers the difference between Pinot Noir and Pinot Grigio, all is good lol.   I will definitely eat here again. Enjoyable food at a reasonable price!!

U95YgZ6wor37zuSPShJlzA.text: Best Thai food in Charlotte, and have been so for over 20 years.  That says it all really.  I have been going to their restaurants since I was a kid.  I continue to go regularly, even living 40 minutes away in Concord.  Everything here is good - from the starters to the ped press wan.

GZU99kQujJYARL_vJm08wg.text: First of all the Taste of Thai food is the absolute best. I love most places that are around here and I like to try new ones. This location is in a good spot because it's me you're a Starbucks and grocery store so I went here for lunch.  Best thing of my visit was the taste of the food. I got the pad si eew with broccoli and carrots and it was delicious. I never get spice because I learned the hard way that Thai spice is not your normal spice. One thing that came with the lunch special like a spring roll and that was a little underwhelming. It literally only contain cabbage and was a little chewy vs crunchy.   Service during lunch rush was decent. I just did a to go order so I thought I would have been in and out a little faster. But they only had one person working the register. I'm a strong proponent that if it is a peak hour of working then there should be ample amount of service people to accommodate.    Would I return absolutely - the food was delicious.

pTTZ2ObDrD-ido2PNKoHqg.text: I truly enjoy the food and people. Extreme friendly customer service that makes the food taste authentic. Guarantee you will be become a regular. Both Restaurants are great.

_4a7u-BDyCjMK6Trqqqkjg.text: This is one of my favorite Thai spots in Charlotte. The green curry is delish, as is the mango and sticky rice when in season. I like to judge a place by their pad thai, which is my staple, and I give them a 4/5. The one subtracted point is because the chicken and shrimp in my last pt tasted like they were boiled and added last...they didn't taste like the rest of the dish. It wasn't bad but I've had better at Thai Taste.   Definitely worth going back again and again.

Lqy7DXWmTsYOyaVXgPr76g.text: I grew up on Thai food and this was not even close to being decent. I had the pad Thai and it was too many peanuts and a ketchup based sauce. Huge disappointment. Will not return and would not recommend this place to anyone looking for an authentic taste.

r2xlGnUaH6dgun1Jt4DWZg.text: Nice area with authentic Thai food. Average pricing is 11.95 to 15.95 per person. Free limited parking available. Nice clean restrooms. Nice for couples, friends and eating alone. Good for eating and reading or surfing internet. Wi-Fi is available but low frequency. Nice for tourists on budget. ENJOY!

VgU1j3aQ8gybEXqktjH1Dw.text: Very good Thai! I am a Thai food snob and it's hard to find in Charlotte. Excellent vegan Green Curry with actual flavorful produce. It's all about the fresh ingredients. Be careful with the spice level. Great staff--intelligent, caring and fast. Great job guys

mzvHv0iijj9gBFZfLPvFJw.text: One word to describe my Chicken Pad Thai that I was craving....DRY!!!!!  I was seriously craving Pad Thai tonight and there aren't many resturant's in the University area that make it (that I'm aware of).  I place my order and ask for no egg.  The food comes out and I check the order before I leave.  It looked a little dry when I opened it and so, I asked for more.  The lady behind the counter said that there is no extra sauce already made up, I would have to request it and they would cook to order.  So I shrugged my shoulders and said ok what can you do, I'm definitely NOT sending food back and make the cook angry (we all know what happens when you do that).  So I got home, made my plate and sat down ready to eat.  I should've know there were going to be problems when all the noodles stuck to my fork and I had to use my other finger to push it onto the plate.  I took the first bite and YUCK !  Taste like I was eating rubber bands and that was just the noodles, the chicken was even worse.  It was solid, wasn't juicy or had any taste to it and hard as a rock.  Guess I can knock this place off my list of resturant's to go back to in the University area.  So disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States

GqXlYQCxmpQdjrf45p7qIg.text: If you are in the mood for Thai- and in the University/Mallard Creek area, this is a solid choice.  It is nestled in a plaza with many other restaurants, a Starbucks and a few other businesses.  You can see the back part of the building from the road if you are searching for it.  I have been here a few times- mostly all during lunch time.  They do have a lunch special with a variety of choices.  They have a very traditional Thai restaurant menu.  I have tried both the Pad Thai and Coconut Red Curry/Panang.  Both were good, but not the most amazing dishes I ever have had.  The one thing I don't love about this location is how it closes in the middle of the day.  I know this is pretty traditional for many Asian type restaurants but it's inconvenient if you are looking for food at non-traditional eating times.    Solid choice but I personally prefer the other Thai restaurant in the University area.

JFAZhxkDe41uUlIbpuZC1Q.text: Food was good, but overpriced in my opinion, especially for the portion sizes. Our service was not great. I want to try the East Blvd. location.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. #35 (cashew stir fry

eZvFEB0MV5ciYrcvWlpBug.text: OK Thai food and a pretty good deal on lunch specials.  That said, if you have the time, go ahead and go one exit down on 85 and hit up Thai house.  Its just nothing special, and with solid Thai food so close by, there's no reason for me to go back unless I get a job in that area.  JMHO.

v7bvff2PD6yS39EJqL-Cvw.text: I got the vegetarian pud see ew (sometimes referred to as "pad see ew") to go. The price was a little steep for how much I got, the flavor was lacking, and the noodles were oily/greasy. There's better thai restaurants in town, so I probably won't be coming back.

HrOq43PT5ZKptJ5r3DaElg.text: I opened my hot to go box, ready to demolish the contents and I see NO CHICKEN. I ordered CHICKEN PAD THAI...where's the chicken. I initially thought that they must have given me the wrong order. However, after some serious digging, I found 3 pieces of chicken. Yes, THREE. I basically paid $10 for noodles and a burnt spring roll :-( Although though the flavor was good, I likely will not be back. I know I can get more bang...or chicken, for my buck.

IFHi5HEtTBZZf9ta5TN4Wg.text: Mmmm such a great find! We had been to this really bad Indian restaurant called Curry and Cakes next to this place, but never knew about this one! We walked in here at about 6:45 one weekend evening, and were a little nervous to see that we were the only customers there. But Yelp reviews can't lie, so we went ahead and took a seat anyway. Sure enough, in about half hour, tables started filling up fast.  Service was quick. I ordered the cashew nut with shrimp, which was pretty good, but my fiance's pad thai was uh-mazing! This restaurant also has a little section where they sell Thai jewelry. Pretty cute stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad thai
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cashew nut shrimp

0ZbTPKVLS2Rxle5Xp7QHww.text: This is my first time here ........ I love the food &  service &  the ambition  Will definitely visit again & refer your place to my friends & colleagues also

DmrtWYMpibI23QZatsNwyg.text: Good, authentic Thai food. A bit limited on menu items though. The staff is very friendly. The service is fast.  I recommend this place for lunch.

rOo9OVwwTBgV4hJumrR4nA.text: Worst customer service experience!  Very nasty old server who doesn't know how to talk or take order.  Owner or manager was watching and did not say a word!  I waited 10 min and no one was come to let us sit.   After all this food was really good. But I don't think I will come back here or recommend anyone else!

-Cq7-dHHiConLpeKss1wPA.text: I was searching for Pad Thai and I landed here.  I really enjoyed the spring rolls; looking forward to trying the summer rolls on my next visit.  The chicken pad Thai was amazing!  You choose the spice range from 1-5.  Great service and wonderful food!  I'll be back soon!!!

iCFSBaAWA0hJsjctKwaLrw.text: Amazing!!!! Highly recommend it!!!!!!! Atmosphere is really nice and creative. The service is right on and so pleasant. Will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pineapple, Chicken Curry... Melts in your mouth and so full of flavor!!!

3GooC83i4rOZoKFhwdHZ9A.text: I came in here for Dinner time with my boyfriend around 5 ish just went they open for dinner. My friend recommended me this place. We went in its was like dead only like other table in their with us. The lady that was taking order was not very happy. She didn't seem like she was interesting in the job. Which is alright. Me and my boyfriend order the summer roll, the yellow curry, fried rice. They food was alright not great. I definitely had better Thai food. The yellow curry tastes blend like their was not taste to it and the size they give you was overpriced. It was not good At all. Had no flavor. The fried rice was surprisingly tasted  good. My boyfriend really enjoyed the fried rice. It was good for me too.  I don't think will be back because we didn't really enjoy the food. The service was not that great too.

kF4lASvxIW6FMc1wdRN3DQ.text: Wow is this Pad Thai excellent! We love to find great Pad Thai food and this was a lucky find. Clean place, including the bathroom. The menu looked great. We will return!

93lk0gkmoTE4gNKf3VgBTQ.text: Just got a "bowl" of coconut soup to go. Came back to to work to eat it, and was very, very disappointed at when I opened my to go bag. The plastic container was half full of the soup. I got the seafood combo, which I paid extra for. That apparently consists of one shrimp and one scallop, with no squid, as I requested. There are 3 GIANT chunks of tomato floating in the soup though, which once taken out of the broth, reduce the contents of the container to less than half of it's potential volume. When I called to ask what the deal was, the lady told me that the next time that I come in, they will give me a little extra soup... I don't really know what that means, but I just wasted $7.50, and will not be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Seafood combo&#34; with 1 shrimp ans 1 scallop
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. So worth the $7.50... not really though  Super salty.
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. The saddest soup ever :(

qjLPsrijWNE38fcZrk5unw.text: I walked in and ordered a vegetarian dish to go.  The food was finished in 5 minutes.  Once I got home I noticed it was chicken instead of tofu. I went back and explained that my order was incorrect. When my order has been messed up at other restaurants, they would at minimum offer an appetizer. All I got was a 'sorry'.  Once again, the food was finished in 5 minutes.  Upon eating, the food tasted as if it was microwaved. There was no flavor at all. Everything was bland and watered down. If you choose to eat here, please check your order before leaving.  I will not return.

nY-keBT-OVrVmPCmpDfeyQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised with my experience at Thai Taste. Their lunch specials start out with a delicious soup. I had the Thai iced tea which has almost a milkshake consistency and was a great treat on a hot day.   Their hotness is 1 to 5, I'm a spicy lover and 4 was perfect for me. A minor punch to the face without causing discomfort. I really enjoyed their tofu, well seasoned and not squishy. It was hard to get our check but all in all a quick and affordable lunch that fits into a work day.

He7o34fEzApUlMGfJ7iZ3w.text: Great mom and pop Thai place. Solid, traditional recipes. Ordered medium spicy, got just that: jalapeno-spicy, perfect for suburban tastes. I will be back.

O5YgDZNUT0BzT_2G3yFIvQ.text: A nice Thai place with some yummy curries and soups. Our favorite is the curry fried rice and the Penang curry. Nice place to dine-in as well.

mCJOaT5-5HJ8PLoc0b8TvQ.text: When I left here, I felt like I had just been at a friend's moms house. And that is the most sincere compliment that I could give this place.   Each lunch meal comes with a cup of soup and spring roll. The soup is broth filled with rice, celery, carrots, tofu and not much else. The spring roll is hot and super crispy but filled with only veggies - mostly cabbage. The soup didn't do for it. Sriracha couldn't save it and so I left mine untouched.   I ordered pad Thai and chicken larb.   The chicken larb was everything. It was funky, spicy, sour and just done right. The only thing I didn't really like is they served it on top of small pieces of lettuce. It's pretty typical to get larb with big pieces of lettuce or cabbage so you can scoop it up and eat it like that. The larb was some of the best I had in a long time. You can pick your level of spicy from from 1-5, I went with five. And the spice and heat did not disappoint.   The pad Thai was definitely a lunch version special. It came with 5 shrimps and was light on the egg and bean sprouts. However the flavor was spot on. It had all the flavors you expect from a well balanced pad Thai - sweet, salty, spicy and plenty of umami.   I'd definitely come back. The staff was friendly, pleasant and attentive without being over bearing. I thought I would be the lone man out eating by myself but seems it's a popular place for a singles lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp pad Thai
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken larb

Ot1YoljkYsxbp3c2Rw1ovQ.text: I've been here a few times and recently stopped in for a quick lunch to go. I received friendly service and was warmly welcomed. I went with the shrimp pad thai lunch special, which the menu said came with a drink, spring roll and soup. The employee helping me said that to go orders didn't come with soup and I was okay with that. She then had another employee settle my bill. As I paid, I asked about the drink and was told it was only for dine in orders. When I asked if I was being charged the same price for the lunch special even though I was getting two less items, I was told yes and that they offer more for dine in customers to encourage people to eat in. My total was right under $12, which wasn't outlandish but I think they should at least provide those ordering to go lunch specials with a drink.   The food itself was pretty good. I received five tail on shrimp that were so large, I cut them in half. The heat (I ordered a level three) was perfect. The spring roll was kinda bland but not the worst thing I've ever had. I do wish they offered side wedges of lime (I was told they don't carry them).

b6cLrI9BJcJp8RT5dQTkpA.text: I was really happy with Thai Taste.  I avoided it for a long time because I don't like the one in Matthews. I don't know if they are the same or owned by the same people or not, but the food is completely different.  They have a lot of really good lunch specials to check out! I had the pad kee mao and enjoyed it.  It was made just how I asked, delicious flavor.  I ordered a number 4 spicy and it could've been even more spicy. They have good sauces, try the green one..very unique.  The mango sticky rice finished off my move perfectly.  Great service and extremely attentive staff!! I will be coming here more often now.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States

XXtjd2XD32tb50Ny8NhxuA.text: This place is bad. The chicken pad Thai is dry. Not only is it dry, but it has no flavor. It is not spicy.

eaAnvurfE1jDTSfr2WkHRw.text: I consider this the best Thai restaurant in Charlotte. It is the same people that founded the original Thai restaurant in Charlotte which was Thai Taste on Monroe Road. That location eventually moved to East Boulevard and they opened a university location later. The son of the original owner primarily runs this location. I have been eating here for many years and the food is always outstanding! Some of my favorite dishes are Gang Dang (Red Curry) with chicken, Pud Gra Pow (minced chicken), Pud Prik Khing (squid or any seafood) and Pud Kee Meow (any seafood).  I like to put fish sauce on any Thai seafood dish but you have to ask for it as they don't keep it on the table. I have been eating Thai food for many years so I usually get mine Thai hot with fresh chilis which they can do. They have lunch specials Monday through Friday until 2:30 PM and Saturday until 3 PM. The lunch specials come with the entree, soup and a spring roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining room.
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch portion of Pud Prik Khing with squid.
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Restaurant hours.

iqOhuu1CS788hAXN6oIaqg.text: Like others have said this place is fine for a quick bite to eat around lunch time, but it isn't great. Their lunch menu consist of about 6-7 options with your choice of protein. The lunch special comes with a soup, spring roll, entree, and tea for a reasonable price. Not the best Thai I've ever had, but not the worst.   The service was friendly and prompt, but the food came out so quick it was obvious that the food was not made to order. I suspect they cook large vats of the dishes and simply add spice to the specification of each order. I expect my food cooked to order...point blank...no discussion. Not sure it would be my first choice for a lunch, but if someone else chose it I wouldn't be adamant about not going.

UCB__GfvRUhlbjiIHdkUoA.text: A solid 3 stars, but I will be back :) One cold afternoon, my boyfriend and I came here to warm up, grab lunch, and satisfy our thai cravings. We were pleasantly surprised by its location; this restaurant is nearby a lot of other spots: a European Wax Center, a 9round, a Cold Stone Creamery. The menu itself was really small -- probably only 6 items for lunch. I ordered the pad thai and enjoyed it, but it fell short of really satisfying that craving I had.  We were in and out within 30-45 minutes? We got the check a couple minutes after they brought our food, which made us feel a little bit rushed.   It is locally owned, and for that reason I think I'll be back.

BxEUNZ8dhnBLkWDVxCi7Pw.text: Located in a mall with series of other restaurants.  We stopped by for lunch. They had a different menu with about 6 items on it for lunch. You could however request for a full menu.   They serve you a soup as soon as you are seated which is not good at all. Way too watery and pretty bland.  The thai ice tea is the worst. It looked like green tea.  The lunch portions are small and pricy for the the quantity they serve. The food was not bad but not the best thai food i had. The spring roll that came with the entree was oily and bland too.  Only good thing was the service - pretty decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch portion
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soup - Not too good (so watery)

7o7wEjv7pg7mch4bUmi-Fg.text: When I lived in Charlotte I often frequented the Thai Taste on East Blvd. Staying with a friend in the university area during a recent trip, I decided to check out this location. I was severely disappointed. The one star is for the fried dumplings that tasted halfway ok but still not what I'm accustomed to when it comes to Thai Taste. I ordered the fried dumplings and chicken pad Thai with number 2 spicy. Or what I call...my usual. And it was horrible. So horrible in fact I ate about 5 spoonfuls before closing the container and just going to bed. The next day I threw it out. I'd hope that it would be similar in flavor but not exactly the same. I also think that this was precooked with meat thrown in. My food came out too fast for it to have been fresh. It had a weird sweetness to it and then a fish oil taste with hints of spice. That's it. No flavor whatsoever. I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States

rS_G8W2OGI5hTAEFnMHJxA.text: The best thai place in charlotte. Good service and friendly people, but most importantly amazing food.

KgeNVAcXyo1GPPbC-OgRyw.text: I like the flavor of the curry dishes, but I wish they were thicker.  Watery is the first texture that comes to mind.  My dinner partner thought the exact same thing.  I didn't like the pad Thai here so take that how you will.  That is usually the go to signature dish but sometimes it tastes too much of fish sauce and not enough of fresh lime.  The pricing is reasonable and unless I am being misled the specials also look good and a bit cheaper than the regular items.

OFkRBQgcJ8DwCwNix0SQCQ.text: One of my favorite spots in the University area. The food is absolutely delicious. I've had a variety of meals from them. My top two are the chicken pad Thai (spicy level 4/5) and the green coconut curry with chicken. I also love the calamari as an appetizer. Prices are decent and you get a large amount of food. I can never finish it all, so I save it for the next day.  The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is cute and quaint. Their decor is very interesting and the area is a good location. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coconut curry with chicken and rice. Comes with an egg roll. On the lunch menu. Delicious.

yMBcFmsPzALUYY9R58-IIQ.text: Unlike most reviewers here, I normal come here for dinner with friends or family. There is a larger menu of dish and I have never been disappointed with anything I ordered! I have loved all the curries- I have tried them all. And a when a friend came along who hadn't tried Thai food we ordered a sesame chicken that was amazing, it was the surprise fabulous dish I never would have expected to be so good here. I have never felt rushed during diner and the service is pretty nice.

zylNrmzR4BH9nJ5zjqxwHQ.text: (Ordered through UberEats)  The chicken pad Thai was extremely disappointing. I can't even stretch to say it was mediocre, because it wasn't. There was zero spice or real flavor besides a tomato based sauce that was somewhat ketchup-y and a few peanut crumbles on top. The chicken was really inconsistently cut, over cooked and rubbery. My boyfriend and I both tried to power through to eat it since we ordered delivery through UberEats (not their fault) and didn't have many other options, but just couldn't do it (yeah, that bad).

8zS8cq_3sSLK33tf11HmFA.text: One of my top two Thai restaurants in this area, this one wins, most of the time, due to its proximity from my house.   They have excellent food, just the right spiciness, delicious and always friendly service. They have different menu for different days.  I like the Tom Yum soup, peanut sauce and basil sauces. Prices are reasonable and the portions are ample. The only negative might be the parking at times. They serve soup at lunch, a smaller portion of the entree. Would love to see them offer brown rice.

AzqTZ-J4iv84qmQQ2HV3gg.text: I don't know how appropriate it is to give review based on an incident but believe it's pretty serious. I ordered a tom yum soup and basil fried rice to go. I found a dead COCKROACH in my soup. I freaked out and called the restaurant immediately. The reaction I got was really surprising  When I reported the insect being found in the soup first reply I got is "oh you can get a new one". Seriously?? That's how you react. It sounded like they are very much use to hearing these kind of things. Then she offered an apology and asked my name so I can get a free soup. Like I want to eat anything from there.   In this whole incident the attitude towards hygiene was dismal. No regret. I really won't how are they passing their sanitation ratings.   A big disappointment. Bad hygiene plus

MTi1HdSHL0tt7jRO3a4JLw.text: A-OK spot for quick, no-frills Thai take out or eat-in. I usually grab my pad thai to go and always have incredibly courteous service. They allow for heat specification and adjustments for any additions/subtractions from the dishes. I like my pad thai peanut-free and high on the heat.  The take out portion is quite generous (as it should be at $11 during the dinner hours) and I get two meals out of it. I do happen to find that the chicken can be a little a dry but the taste is still good.  Thai Taste has great lunch specials and I advise going during the lunch hours to get your own taste of Thai at a much more reduced price.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste at University - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken pad thai to-go

FjUMFI13wEGv0WY5QZUIaA.text: I rarely give a 2 star review especially for small local businesses but this place really turned me off. Being Asian and super busy with work, I am always looking for good comfort foods that remind me of home cooking. I was so happy when I moved to the area and found a Thai place nearby.  I always give a restaurant multiple tries before I write a negative review so that I am fair when rating. With that being said, the first time I ordered from there the food was bland and portion sizes were on the scant size for price. The second time I ordered from there, food was still lacking the vivid flavor and aroma that Thai food is known for. I still tried to give them a chance, and on the third try I was not able to pick up my order so I sent my sister instead. She wasn't very familiar with the area and showed up about 15min min late since the restaurant was closing for lunch to prepare for dinner.  My sister came home upset with the take out order in her hand. I asked her what had happened and she told me that while she picked up the food and apologized for being a little late, she could hear the staff in the back near the kitchen talking about her in Thai. Yes! Suprise!!!! My sister speaks Thai! The satff was complaining about customers like "her" who can't "read" opening and closing times...and blah blah blah. How condescending!  For a restaurant that is seldom busy and struggling to stay open, you would think that they would be thankful for the customers they receive. Your customers are your livelihood!

9J3bNGufXXOiuKMUOJfamQ.text: Used a groupon when I came here with a coworker. I've never eaten Thai food before so I can't speak on authenticity or comparisons to other Thai joints.   I ordered a scallop and shrimp pasta dish and my coworker ordered a stir fry type dish. Both dishes were pretty good and very flavorful. The portions were perfect-sized for lunch. If I wasn't starving at the time, I could've eaten half for lunch and half for dinner.   The ambience is decent. It's a little on the small side but somewhat intimate.   Staff is very friendly and helpful. No complaints regarding service.   4 stars for good food, great location, and great customer service.

sHmbR4vFWgQFqaGfum_VZA.text: Went there with a groupon and liked it so much we've gotten take out again!  Really good food and you can choose how spicy you want the dish to be.

7AsSoTUC8kMg0SBRyB2vIA.text: I've been to this place a couple of times.  The first time was OK.  Months passed, and I went back again with my students.  I ordered Pad Lad Nar with beef (listed as a "special", and usually a foolproof dish in Thai restaurants) and it was extremely meh.  Broccoli very undercooked, sauce runny and hadn't been given enough cooking to "come together".  Not horrible enough to send it back, but not good enough to think "hey, wow, I want to go there again".  Especially when I can get great noodle dishes at several different places around the University.

1F-Zhp7YhPs_9tUHJ4Q0YA.text: Wow!  I haven't been here in a couple years, but I was in the area tonight and ordered the Pad Thai Chicken to go with a side of peanut sauce.  It was really good!   I devoured it!  I wasn't exactly cheap at $12, but it is easily two meals.  I will be back again!

gpdXETUNkZEAWEqN0pboEw.text: The other reviewers seemed to be first timers, but not me!  I have been here probably 30 times at least!    I LOVE THIS PLACE.  We have been customers here since they opened the University restaurant.  The wait staff is wonderful - the same people have been working here for years - and very helpful with the menu for those that are not as knowledgeable about Thai food.  My favorites... shrimp pad thai (sweet flavor and GIANT shrimp), shrimp fried rice (smoky taste, with those giant shrimp again!), spring rolls, wonderful lunch soup.  My husband orders curried tofu and is always pleased.  The restaurant is very accommodating to large parties, especially those with children.  We always bring our out of town guests to eat here and it has always been a wonderful exerience.

JAxJaqxFoOpdYGTiakjuTA.text: Thai Taste has decent Pad Thai and Green Curry, two of my favorite Thai dishes. THey offer heat levels from 0-5 plus "Thai Spicy". Beware though because just yesterday  my wife received green curry which was ordered with heat level 1, but it had considerable heat, I would rate the heat a 3. They also offer papaya salad which is good. I am going to try the Tom Yum soup at some point soon. The lunch specials are very affordable and the service is quick.

h_rLog6tdpSrQOeNKrQ6GQ.text: I love Thai food.  The food here is okay, the price is too much for the portions at lunch.  I told him I did not want it too spicy, he did not add any seasonings.  I may go back just not on my dime.

is63kl0OOxMwDkIQzgYQ2A.text: This place is right next to my office, so I love to run over and grab the lunch specials when I have time. My only disappointment is that you have to dine in to get the free soup, spring roll, and iced tea that makes "the special". Perfect for satisfying my craving for Thai, however. And since I'm a wimp when it comes to heat, I like being able to order the level of spice according to my mood that day.

NVdksHR9EpXJecKc5hYT1Q.text: I love this place, I visit at least once a week and order the Pad Thai w/ Shrimp.  The dish is so flavorful and delicious.  Unfortunately I can't really comment on other items on the menu because this is all I ever order :)  I've tried Pad Thai at other restaurants and they don't come close.
